overview:
Mike is an Angel Investor at Rothenberg Ventures, focused on investing in talented and passionate world-class founders, and a student at Harvard Business School.

Additionally, Mike is a Director at Rothenberg Investments, where he manages private equity capital to invest in condos and land development in central Texas. As an entrepreneur, Mike founded four companies including Rothenberg Ventures, Rothenberg Investments, Cardinal Tutoring (25 Stanford tutors), and TinyCFO (budget management and receipt-processing web-based tool in Beta).

As an Associate at Audax Private Equity, Mike was responsible for analysis, preliminary deal diligence, deal execution, portfolio management, and facilitating sale processes. As an Associate Consultant at Bain, he consulted for Fortune 500 companies on a variety of industries including e-commerce, enterprise software, and payments.

At Stanford, Mike studied Management Science and Engineering (B.S. & M.S), coordinated ETL (with 2.5M annual podcast downloads), piloted the Tsinghua Fellowship for six months in Beijing, led Sigma Nu Fraternity, and competed in Ultimate Frisbee. Prior to Stanford, Mike was selected as part of the 30-person USA Math Olympiad Team (2001).
